insurer_name: Financial & Legal Insurance Company Limited (underwriter), administered by Lexelle Limited
coverage_summary: Legal expenses insurance covering costs up to £50,000 for legal issues relating to the insured's second property (including static caravans and park homes) used for short-term lets. Covers contract disputes, property protection, legal defence, and identity theft matters.
key_inclusions: 24x7 Free Legal Advice Line for personal legal matters within covered sections
Contract Disputes - negotiation of legal rights arising from agreements for buying, selling or hiring goods/services
Property Protection - civil actions relating to land, building or contents of let property
Legal Defence - defence against prosecutions arising from letting the property
Identity Theft - reimbursement for costs incurred from identity theft that wrongly affects credit rating or debt responsibility
key_exclusions: Contracts relating to profession, business or employment including letting out the let property
Lease, licence or tenancy of land or buildings including the let property
Construction work/building or home extension for let property where dispute is £10,000 or less
First £250 of legal costs for trespass or nuisance claims
Ownership or boundary disputes other than at let property
Claims relating to buildings or land other than let property
Claims relating to motorised vehicles, mining or subsidence
Boundary disputes predating policy or within first 180 days
Legal defence where advised to plead guilty
Legal defence without reasonable prospects of acquittal
Claims not arising from letting the let property
Identity theft not affecting credit rating or debt responsibility
Claims where policyholder doesn't own property and lacks written authority to sub-let
Claims relating to or caused by letting property or against tenant/guest
Properties operated as HMO (Home of Multiple Occupation), B&B or hotel
Claims pursued outside England & Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland jurisdiction

sub_limits.property_protection_excess: £250 excess for trespass or nuisance claims

special_conditions: Must use representative or solicitor nominated and appointed by insurer prior to proceedings
Must provide full and accurate information; failure may invalidate policy
Must inform insurer if information becomes inaccurate or changes
Property must be second property (not primary residence)
Property can include static caravans and park homes
Must own the let property or have written authority from owner to sub-let
No claims can be made or pending to qualify for cancellation refund
excess_deductible: £250 excess applies to legal costs for Property Protection claims relating to trespass or nuisance only
geographical_coverage: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland. Claims must be pursued within jurisdiction of courts of England & Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland
pre_existing_conditions: Boundary disputes and ownership disputes predating the period of insurance or within first 180 days are excluded
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling off period from date of purchase or receipt of documentation (whichever is later) for full premium refund if no claims made or pending. After 14 days, pro-rata refund available if no claims made or pending. Contact organisation from whom policy was purchased to cancel.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: Not specified in this document - refer to full policy documentation
required_documents: Not specified in this IPID - full documentation requirements in complete policy documents
process_steps: Insurer will assess reasonable prospects of success
Use nominated representative or solicitor appointed by insurer
Proceed with legal action if approved
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Must demonstrate reasonable prospects of success for Legal Defence claims. Must show wrongful effect on credit rating or debt responsibility for Identity Theft claims
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Contact details not provided in IPID - refer to policy schedule

eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Not specified, but contracts relating to profession, business or employment (including letting) are excluded from Contract Disputes cover
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be within United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
other_restrictions: Must own the let property or have written authority from owner to sub-let
Property must be a second property (not primary residence)
Property cannot be operated as HMO, B&B or hotel
Property can be static caravan or park home
Property must be used for short period lets
Cannot make claims relating to or against tenants or their guests

policy_definitions.let_property: The insured's second property including static caravans and park homes used for short period lets
policy_definitions.HMO: Home of Multiple Occupation - excluded from coverage
policy_definitions.Duration of Cover: One calendar year from date policy was issued
policy_definitions.reasonable prospects: Used to assess Legal Defence claims - must have reasonable prospects of being acquitted of all charges
policy_definitions.statement of facts: Information provided by policyholder that forms the basis of the policy
policy_definitions.identity theft: Another party stealing and using identity that wrongly affects credit rating or creates wrongful debt responsibility

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: 180 days for boundary disputes and ownership disputes at let property
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Must inform insurer as soon as possible if information becomes inaccurate or changes
time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Claims must occur within policy period
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from date of purchase or receipt of policy documentation (whichever is later) for full refund

regulatory_compliance.fair_treatment_obligations: Must provide full and accurate information. Insurer must be notified of any changes. Failure to provide accurate information may invalidate policy and claims may not be paid
regulatory_compliance.complaints_process: Not detailed in this IPID - refer to full policy documentation

Your answers will form part of the statement of facts on which your policy will be based
Failure to provide accurate information or notify changes may invalidate your policy and claims may not be paid

common_questions.question: Can I use this policy for disputes with my tenants?
common_questions.answer: No. Claims relating to or caused by letting the let property or against a tenant or their guests are specifically excluded.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - General exclusions

common_questions.question: Does this cover my main home?
common_questions.answer: No. This policy is specifically for second properties (including static caravans and park homes) used for short period lets.
common_questions.section_reference: What is this type of Insurance?

common_questions.question: Can I use my own solicitor?
common_questions.answer: No. Prior to any proceedings you must use the representative or solicitor nominated and appointed by the insurer.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Is there a waiting period before I can claim?
common_questions.answer: Yes, for boundary disputes and ownership disputes at your let property, there is a 180-day waiting period from the start of cover.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Property Protection

common_questions.question: What is the maximum the policy will pay out?
common_questions.answer: £50,000 maximum during the entire duration of cover (aggregate limit for all claims combined).
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Can I use this for an Airbnb property?
common_questions.answer: Yes, short period lets are covered, but the property cannot be operated as an HMO, B&B or hotel.
common_questions.section_reference: What is this type of Insurance? and What is not insured - General

common_questions.question: Does this cover tenancy agreement disputes?
common_questions.answer: No. Leases, licences or tenancies of land or buildings including your let property are excluded from Contract Disputes coverage.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Contract Disputes

common_questions.question: What if I'm sub-letting someone else's property?
common_questions.answer: You must have written authority from the owner to sub-let the property, otherwise claims are excluded.

common_questions.question: Is there an excess I need to pay?
common_questions.answer: Yes, there is a £250 excess for legal costs relating to trespass or nuisance claims under Property Protection.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured - Property Protection

common_questions.question: Can I get a refund if I cancel?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Full refund within 14 days of purchase/receipt of documents if no claims made or pending. Pro-rata refund after 14 days if no claims made or pending.
common_questions.section_reference: How do I cancel the contract?
